intro: Onosma emodi var. stelligera, commonly known as the Himalayan fleabane, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in open meadows and mountain slopes. It has a compact growth habit with basal leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This variant is distinguished by its stellate (star-shaped) hairs and its ability to thrive in cold, harsh environments.
